APA Text for Paired-Samples T-Test

Source: R/apa_t_pair.R
apa_t_pair.Rd

Create APA-formatted text for the results of a paired-samples t-test.

Usage

apa_t_pair(x, y, dv = "the DV", level1 = "level 1", level2 = "level 2")

Arguments

x

A numeric vector of values for level 1.

y

A numeric vector of values for level 2.

dv

A character string describing the dependent variable (DV) in the output statement. Default is "the DV".

level1

A character string describing level 1 in the output statement. Default is "level 1".

level2

A character string describing level 2 in the output statement. Default is "level 2".

Value

A character string with the APA-formatted results of the paired-samples t-test.

Examples

# Assuming self_res_att is a dataframe loaded in your environment
apa_t_pair(x = self_res_att$f_self, y = self_res_att$f_non)
#> A paired-samples t-test was conducted to compare the DV between level 1 (M = 3.5, SD = 1.6) and level 2 (M = 3.0, SD = 1.2). There was a significant difference; t(107) = 3.60, p = 0.000.

# Specify the text for DV and levels
apa_t_pair(x = self_res_att$f_self, y = self_res_att$f_non,
           dv = "preferences for female faces",
           level1 = "participants who resembled those faces",
           level2 = "non-self participants")
#> A paired-samples t-test was conducted to compare preferences for female faces between participants who resembled those faces (M = 3.5, SD = 1.6) and non-self participants (M = 3.0, SD = 1.2). There was a significant difference; t(107) = 3.60, p = 0.000.
